item.title: Report E-2025060236
item.description:
Report E-2025060236

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-10
  • City: FESTUS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 10, 2025, three (3) 5-gallon pails of adhesive were damaged due to a loading strap error and released approximately 5-gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from ES+ to remediate the site. The crew utilized granular absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted trailer. All impacted materials and the damaged pails were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025060890
item.description:
Report X-2025060890

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-05
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: GROUND HAZMAT PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE. DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED DONNING THE PROPER PPE AND WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED AND A SMALL SIX-INCH RADIUS PUDDLE OF MATERIAL CLEANED UP. ALL MATERIALS WERE TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED A SMALL PIN-HEAD SIZE PUNCTURE ON THE BOTTOM RIGHT CONRNER OF THE FIVE-GAL POLY, CLOSED-HEAD PAIL. IT APPEARS TO HAVE COME IN CONTACT WITH A SHARP OBJECT.

item.title: Report X-2025060645
item.description:
Report X-2025060645

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-04
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: GROUND PACKAGE, FULLY LABELED HAZMAT PACKAGE THAT APPEARED TO BE LEAKING WAS DISCOVERED BY A LOADER ON THE PD2. THE LOADER LEFT THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR. A DMP RESPONDER ARRIVED WITHIN 5 MINUTES DONNING THE APPROPRIATE PPE WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILLCART. USING THE DECISION TREE AND CORRECT RESPONSE SHEET IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE PACKAGE COULD BE SAFELY TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION IT WAS REVEALED THAT ONE OF THE CAPS ON ONE OF THE INNER ONE GALLON PLASTIC CONTAINERS WAS LOOSE BY 1/2 A TURN AND 6 OUNCES OF LIQUID HAD LEAKED OUT ONTO THE OUTER CARTON.

item.title: Report X-2025060595
item.description:
Report X-2025060595

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-03
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: GROUND STANDARD HAZARDOUS MATERIALS PACKAGE WAS FOUND LEAKING. WITHIN 3 MINUTES A DMP RESPONDER ARRIVED DONNING THE CORRECT PPE WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. USING THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE PACKAGE COULD BE SAFELY TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION IT WAS REVEALED THAT THE CLOSURES ON THE ONE LITER INNER PLASTIC CONTAINERS SEEMED TO BE CLOSED TIGHTLY BUT A SMALL AMOUNT OF LIQUID MANAGED TO SEEP OUT AND SOAK A PORTION OF THE OUTER CARTON.

item.description:
Report X-2025060330

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-28
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE, ON IT'S SIDE AND EMITTING A STRONG PUNGENT ODOR. 2 OF 6 POLY 2.5 LITER CONTAINERS WERE CRUSHED AND CRACKED, CAUSING THE LIQUID PRODUCT TO SPILL THROUGH THE BREACH(S). TTHE INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL CONSISTED OF CORRUGATED PARTITIONS AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A DOUBLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 51 LBS/IN EDGE CRUSH TEST (ECT).

item.title: Report X-2025052229
item.description:
Report X-2025052229

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-23
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT APPROXIMATELY 17:30 THE SUPERVISOR FROM UNLOAD B CALLED DMP ABOUT A LEAKING PACKAGE IN DOOR 15. A DESIGNATED RESPONDER DONNED ALL APPROPRIATE PPE AND RETRIEVED A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. AFTER ARRIVING ON SCENE, THE RESPONDER NOTICED A HAZMAT PACKAGE WITH MOISTURE SEEPING OUT OF ONE OF THE CORNERS OF THE PACKAGE. THE RESPONDER THEN REFERRED TO THEIR DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET AND ACTED ACCORDINGLY. AFTER CLEANING UP ALL SPILL DEBRIS THE PACKAGE WAS TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. UPON OPENING THE SINGLEWALL FIBREBOARD BOX IT WAS DISCOVERED THE CAUSE OF THE LEAK WAS A PUNTURE HOLE IN THE BODY OF THE CONTAINER. THE PACKAGE WAS FINALLY DISPOSED OF ACCORDING TO THE DMP WASTE DISPOSAL FLOW CHART.

item.title: Report X-2025052173
item.description:
Report X-2025052173

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-22
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT APPROXIMATELY 18:30 THE SUPERVISOR FROM SORT AISLE A CALLED DMP ABOUT A LEAKING PACKAGE ON THE SORT TABLE WHICH APPEARED TO BE A HAZMAT. A DESIGNATED RESPONDER DONNED ALL APPROPRIATE PPE AND RETRIEVED A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. UPON ARRIVAL A HAZMAT PACKAGE WAS SEEN LAYING ON ITS SIDE WITH A WET SPOT ON TWO CORNERS OF THE OUTER CARTON. AFTER REFERRING TO THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE RESPONDER ACTED ACCORDINGLY. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. ALL MATERIALS WERE THEN DISPOSED OF ACCORDING TO THE DMP DISPOSAL FLOW CHART.

CONTENTS WERE PROCESSED FOLLOWING DMP/DMN PROCEDURES WITHOUT INCIDENT.

item.title: Report X-2025051623
item.description:
Report X-2025051623

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-15
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED STAINED IN APPEARANCE AND EMITTING A STRONG SOLVENT-LIKE ODOR BY AN UNLOADER IN SECTION-A. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG SHE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HER IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN A FEW MINUTES A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE AND WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT A METAL 5-GAL PAIL WAS BREACHED AND HAD LEAKED APPROX. 12 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID PRODUCT. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL WITH ALOT OF ROOM FOR THE CONTAINER TO MOVE AROUND INSIDE OF THE CARTON. THE OUTER CONTAINMENT WAS A DOUBLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX RATED AT A 48 LBS/IN EDGE CRUSH TEST (ECT).

  • Description: At 2:08 AM ET, Ryan Jenning with XSL contacted the call center to report a spill that was found inside of a trailer in St. Louis, MO. The spill consists of approximately 2 gallons of FAST DRY 4180 GRAY PRIMER, which released from a (1) 5-gallon metal drum due to a puncture from the pallet as it was unloaded, impacting the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal, who stated they will clean the spill with absorbents and place the waste into a 20-gallon metal drum. Waste ID 237772-1 was generated.

item.title: Report E-2025060099
item.description:
Report E-2025060099

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-06
  • City: SAINT PETERS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) liters of material released from one (1) 3.5-liter metal can due to a forklift accident resulting in the can being damaged. The released material impacted the concrete dock. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. Another 5-gallon poly drum was used to containerize the damaged product. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025050404
item.description:
Report E-2025050404

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-25
  • City: SAINT LOUIS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: t 4:33 AM ET, Zach with XSL contacted the call center to report a spill that occurred inside of a trailer in St. Louis, MO. The spill consists of 5 pounds of Phycomycin SCP, which released from 2–50-pound paper bags due to other freight crushing the bags prior to arrival, causing them to spill onto the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal, and it was determined a contractor will be required as this is a 5.1 release. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-pounds of UN3378 Phycomycin SCP released to trailer floor due to improper loading. The crew found (2) 50-pound paper bags were damaged. The damaged bags were overpacked into a vented 55-gallon poly drum and spill debris, pallet pieces and PPE were containerized into 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) cup of material released from one (1) 5-gallon plastic pail due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the pail leaking. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 10-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025050400
item.description:
Report E-2025050400

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-22
  • City: MARSHFIELD
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1330 ET, XPO-XSJ notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported that approximately 5-6 cups of UN 2796. The release impacted inside trailer#321-4542 and the concrete underneath the trailer. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. ERTS will proceed to dispatch a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. An ETA will be provided once it is known. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of UN2796 Smart Shine product released to the wooden trailer floor and concrete area due to container failure. The crew applied water and baking soda to the impacted surfaces, then absorbed with granular absorbents. The damaged drum was overpacked in an 85-gallon poly drum and neutralized absorbents were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
